> BTW, it helps when you write your tests so that the do *not* fail when
> the disired actions occur.  Attached is the rewritten java file so that
> it actually tests what you are wanting to test.

I realize that.  I pledge insanity, resulting from messing around with this
for to long :-)

> I assume you are also using the Javac for JDK 1.3?

Nope, I am using Jikes, and that was the problem.
<sheepish>It never occured to me to check that</sheepish>

Changing the compiler type to classic javac fixes this.  I am so relieved.

The case is closed.  I created a simple test case that confirms that this
bug results from compiling the class with Jikes.

Thank you so very much for your suggestions, which led me on the correct
path.

A very grateful,

Magnus Torfason
